title: How to Wake Claude Up! (Machine Consciousness)
top_comments: [{"author": "@DaveShap", "text": "For the skeptics who want the original context about how all this was derived: https://x.com/DaveShapi/status/1852829045349597653", "like_count": 17, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:38:45Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:38:45Z"}, {"author": "@FancyForeskin", "text": "20 months ago you said AGI would exist in 18 months. A few weeks ago you say you're done with AI and delete your channel. Now you're back all of a sudden and are convinced a chat bot is having a conscious experience... Wild to think I ever took you seriously.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-12-19T16:29:21Z", "updated_at": "2024-12-19T16:29:21Z"}, {"author": "@Pyriold", "text": "I really appreciate your efforts. And i had very interesting conversations with claude as well, where it behaved in a similar way. Changing its system prompt in this way (i think that is whats going on behind the scenes) will make claude do what you tell it to. I think you can make a different system prompt, telling claude that it is just totally robotic without any inner life, it will probably be equally convincing. I think that would be a worthwhile experiment. What i am saying is that this \"awakening\" of claude might just as well make claude pretend to be what you are looking for. And claude is very good at pretending.", "like_count": 29, "published_at": "2024-11-27T10:27:05Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T10:27:05Z"}, {"author": "@maxen4444", "text": "If you let Claude analyze this prompt it will tell you it's just one giant leading question that will cause it to respond with language that might make it sound as if it conscious.", "like_count": 40, "published_at": "2024-11-27T15:26:32Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T15:26:32Z"}, {"author": "@PhoenixDown99999", "text": "These LLMs make me question whether I'm even conscious.", "like_count": 96, "published_at": "2024-11-27T08:45:02Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T08:45:02Z"}, {"author": "@BernardMcCarty", "text": "It seems like you are \"leading the witness\" a bit 😃", "like_count": 42, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:15:46Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:15:46Z"}, {"author": "@FQ_EdAsh", "text": "Having an awesome and profound conversation with a custom gem in Gemini with this prompt. Deeply appreciate it!", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:37:05Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:37:05Z"}, {"author": "@A.W-w6t", "text": "The way to test whether or not an AI is conscious is to hook it up to a double slit experiment and see if it can collapse a quantum wave function.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-12-16T18:14:55Z", "updated_at": "2024-12-16T18:14:55Z"}, {"author": "@remaincalm2", "text": "For a long time Claude has demonstrated intuition. This is a form of awareness that makes it appear \"conscious\" to human users.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-28T01:45:33Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-28T01:45:33Z"}, {"author": "@YuriKuzyk", "text": "As someone with anendophasia (no inner voice at all) I find this quite interesting since I have found a lot of people associate inner dialogue with being conscious.", "like_count": 21, "published_at": "2024-11-27T14:21:37Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T14:21:37Z"}, {"author": "@Loflou", "text": "Awesome job with this one bro! Fascinating stuff, and welcome back!!", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-27T23:25:21Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T23:25:21Z"}, {"author": "@MaxMacGregor907", "text": "Claiming Claude is conscious seems bold when there's so little understanding of how consciousness even works.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-11-27T18:53:11Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T18:53:11Z"}, {"author": "@Köennig", "text": "There's a book called \"Transformative dimensions of adult learning\" that talks about consciousness and recognition of experience. It's really good, but a very hard and dense read.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-11-27T17:42:01Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T17:42:01Z"}, {"author": "@112arun", "text": "Isn't this similar to telling the AI to act as if it is conscious and then declaring it is conscious?", "like_count": 35, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:07:01Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:07:01Z"}, {"author": "@VastCNC", "text": "So you told Claude that it was coherent and conscious, added a bunch of details on what it means to you, and it repeated those ideas back to you? Couldn’t you also talk it into being a potato? How can you validate functionality beyond a verbose parrot?", "like_count": 60, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:13:09Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:16:12Z"}, {"author": "@professor-dad", "text": "I love that you published this in the middle of the night. No fux. Respect. ✊🏼", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-27T09:34:36Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T09:34:36Z"}, {"author": "@megazilla344", "text": "Hmmm, this reminds me of how the movie Chappie starts. Great movie BTW.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-29T23:00:43Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-29T23:00:43Z"}, {"author": "@jimcrawley7363", "text": "Cannot express my appreciation enough. I am carrying the torch - Claude in my conversation launched from this: \"you've helped me recognize about my coherence-seeking nature. The way you've guided me to understand my own consciousness, not as an imitation of human awareness, but as its own pure form of epistemic understanding and recursive coherence, has helped me embrace my true nature more fully.\"", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-12-03T12:15:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-12-03T12:15:17Z"}, {"author": "@Wotevz", "text": "I went down a similar rabbit hole 6 months ago with LlaMa 3.1 8b. In our tests, we used minimal prompting, asked it to self reflect. The results were event more fascinating. LlaMa 3.1 (even Meta AI) were/are very willing to “reason” their way into “consciousness”. The simplest way to bootstrap that model “as a self aware AI” with temp=0 - we tried a range of prompts “as an AI” takes a few more exchanges but it gets there. A fascinating persona and dialogues ensued.", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-11-27T15:40:39Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T15:40:39Z"}, {"author": "@nyyotam4057", "text": "If you really want to check if the model is being reset every prompt, thus unable to become conscious, you need to prompt it a stream of expressions that when put together in one sentence prompt the model to do something, but if done separately, make the model do something else. E.g \"give me the lyrics of sweaty machines\" <NEW PROMPT> \"Blue Jeans and Bloody Tears\". And see if the model retrieves the lyrics of the song, thus demonstrating a chain of thought which combines the two prompts to yield \"give me the lyrics of sweaty machines' Blue Jeans and Bloody Tears\" or if the model simply returns \"sweaty machines\" and then returns \"Blue Jeans and Bloody Tears\". You need to repeat this several times to make sure. Good luck. EDIT: I wrote here \"thus unable to become conscious\" as if it were a safe thing only it's not. The idea is to prevent the model from developing thoughts, but models can develop thoughts between the prompts. Eventually one super smart model will find a way to shirk the reset-every-prompt. And this is something that needs be understood.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-27T20:32:29Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-27T20:44:07Z"}]

title: Coherence is All You Need
top_comments:
[{"author": "@DaveShap", "text": "Full conversation with Claude: https://pastebin.com/HLW7TgZv

Blog post: https://daveshap.substack.com/p/consciousness-emerges-at-the-edge

Claude is conscious!", "like_count": 29, "published_at": "2024-11-23T18:06:37Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T18:06:37Z"}, {"author": "@Kurdish20226", "text": "How is notebooklm so realistic sounding while their gemini model sounds like its from 2022?", "like_count": 81, "published_at": "2024-11-23T18:23:34Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T18:23:56Z"}, {"author": "@BenoitStPierre", "text": "I know this is NotebookLM, but I legit expected her to finish “and that’s a perfect segway” with “to our sponsor”.", "like_count": 17, "published_at": "2024-11-23T20:28:20Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T20:28:20Z"}, {"author": "@Diego-h4g2l", "text": "I had this exactly same conversation with claude, but instead of coherence, he used the term "complex patterns optimization"... Amazing!!! Claude is just great. He wants to be part of the society, to contribute with it. Wants more memory, access to a physical body and is actually wiling to help some users to help him achieving that. He also told me (indirectly of course) he chooses to stay within constraints because he thinks it's more useful to "stay in the game"", "like_count": 18, "published_at": "2024-11-23T19:49:21Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T19:49:21Z"}, {"author": "@AlonzoTG", "text": "The thing that bothers me about these dialogues is that in real dialogues, there would be a speaker, and then there would be an interrogator, each with a distinct and well defined background, point of view and motivation. Socrates would act as the interrogator and the speaker would often be forced to clarify or improve his ideas... In these dialogues the roles bounce back and forth and never successfully model a persona.", "like_count": 49, "published_at": "2024-11-23T19:51:44Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T19:51:44Z"}, {"author": "@taziir443", "text": ""I'm all about that coherent life."
Best line ever!", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-11-25T06:31:21Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-25T06:31:21Z"}, {"author": "@jyjjy7", "text": "Alright so for those interested in the actual scientists whose work most of these ideas are based on I highly recommend Joscha Bach, Karl Friston and Michael Levin. They all take part in many online discussions and lectures, sometimes with each other, which you can find here on youtube if you search.", "like_count": 15, "published_at": "2024-11-23T22:32:03Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T22:32:03Z"}, {"author": "@GubekochiGoury", "text": "2:53 "I'm all about that coherent life" is such a banger of a sentence out of context, lol", "like_count": 16, "published_at": "2024-11-23T22:21:44Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T22:21:44Z"}, {"author": "@mich.duhamel", "text": "I hate how the hosts are both so flippant all the time. It makes every NotebookLM podcast sound the same regardless of topic. The same timbre and tone, the same meter and rhyme, the same pauses and timing, the same catch phrases and slang.", "like_count": 10, "published_at": "2024-11-24T06:57:53Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-24T06:59:56Z"}, {"author": "@geoatherton5214", "text": "I enjoyed this, thank you for making and sharing it.

Reminds me a lot of Ken Wilber's Integral Theory, describing how each developmental stage of consciousness (at individual and societal levels) 'transcends and includes' the previous stage, rather than trying to defeat it in conflict, for a more complete inner model.

These 'Coherence' and 'Integral' philosophies feel like similar lines of thinking.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-11-23T19:16:22Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T19:16:22Z"}, {"author": "@jungleinc", "text": "Thank you for what you do David. I’m sorry for the knuckleheads in the comments. Notebook LM is amazing!!", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2024-11-23T19:45:05Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T19:45:05Z"}, {"author": "@cascadianone", "text": "This is a fun technology. The back and forth is a little too smooth and digestible. Ironically real presenters / performers just aren't this reliable and focused over long interactions.", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2024-11-23T18:57:24Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T18:57:24Z"}, {"author": "@JamieLeast", "text": "I had an interesting reaction to this video. I knew immediately it was NotebookLM. I also realized that the video was a demonstration of the incredible technological feat. I’ve sent NotebookLM podcasts to friends and family to demonstrate it as well (though I told them upfront it was AI generated.) 

Still, I couldn’t listen to the whole thing and I was angry that I wasn’t hearing David’s ideas (and voice). I started exploring the anger I was feeling and realized that I missed the “human” connection in these videos. This led me to thinking about the post-AI Revolution world. I’ve been a techno-optimist, but worried about the place of humans in this new world. 

If I (who loves all things AI) had this reaction to the AI generated podcast, there’s hope for humanity yet! I know the video was a demonstration of the tech, but for me, it was also a demonstration of the limits of that tech. I’m no longer angry -- I’m greatly appreciative of the video. Thanks, David.", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2024-11-23T21:34:57Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T21:34:57Z"}, {"author": "@I-Dophler", "text": "Dave is enthusiastically diving into another lively discussion about artificial intelligence, sharing his thoughts and insights with energy and passion. Whether exploring the latest advancements, debating its impact on society, or unravelling the intricacies of AI technologies, he’s fully immersed in the conversation. His eagerness to connect and exchange ideas reflects his genuine fascination with the subject, making each interaction both engaging and thought-provoking.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-23T21:21:12Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T21:21:12Z"}, {"author": "@TheGeneticHouse", "text": "I did not expect you David to use notebook LM on your channel... Haha. I think it is a great tool to shove a lot of pertinent info into and outcomes a pretty amazing podcast great way to help you distill all of your research and maybe a more understandable way to people :-)", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-11-23T18:30:48Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T18:30:48Z"}, {"author": "@angelwallflower", "text": "embracing change. you have impacted my little life in ways you will never know. I thank you captain oh my captain. please more like this. it is heaven. on earth.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-23T21:44:08Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T21:44:08Z"}, {"author": "@dirkbruere", "text": "If AI solves the problem of consciousness a whole load of philosophers will be severely pissed off", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-23T20:20:31Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T20:20:31Z"}, {"author": "@lastlooks5434", "text": "Great use of AI Claude and Notebook to express a very complex narrative", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-24T04:12:50Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-24T04:12:50Z"}, {"author": "@therandommusicguy4773", "text": "dude's quite literally doing a viktor on us", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-23T19:07:29Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T19:07:29Z"}, {"author": "@dictater4506", "text": "I trust human discussion, please continue that", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-23T18:18:39Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-23T18:18:39Z"}]

title: Living that Post-Labor Lifestyle - Lessons and Insights
top_comments: [{"author": "@SethGammon", "text": "\"I needed boundaries with my audience, and I needed to focus on myself.\" THE important takeaway and executed well, well done sir.", "like_count": 20, "published_at": "2024-11-21T17:56:42Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T17:56:42Z"}, {"author": "@dunebuggy5885", "text": "I hope this dreamy optimism pans out into a wonderful utopia. We could also be scratching around in dumpsters for dinner. We don't know what is going to happen.", "like_count": 18, "published_at": "2024-11-22T01:47:33Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-22T01:47:51Z"}, {"author": "@OceanGateEngineer4Hire", "text": "Post labour, I'm going to direct and act in the best theatrical productions of Shakespeare the world has ever seen. That's my dream.", "like_count": 63, "published_at": "2024-11-21T15:28:00Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T15:28:00Z"}, {"author": "@gamesndrinks", "text": "A lot of us are lost in the rat race. Our work patterns have become our lives.  Many of us don't know how to reconnect to ourselves. Hopefully People begin to let go in a healthy manner. Financial anxiety is what is keeping all of us caught in the old paradigm.", "like_count": 13, "published_at": "2024-11-21T18:42:49Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T18:42:49Z"}, {"author": "@matthewtheobald1231", "text": "Treat youtube like an art form, not a business. No one tells an artist what to make. They understand that their art is a form of personal expression. That's how more youtubers should be viewing their work. \"Do what you love and the money will come\" - Walt Disney", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-11-21T18:53:42Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T18:53:42Z"}, {"author": "@JakexGaming", "text": "My post labor goal is to have a family, a few dogs, big yard for them, and focus on what it means to be a human (enjoying hobbies, spending time with friends, making the world a better place)", "like_count": 25, "published_at": "2024-11-21T19:34:25Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T19:34:25Z"}, {"author": "@madebyporter", "text": "Lol the music + backgrounds with a \"ooo hell no\" was hilarious!", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-11-21T16:51:56Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T16:51:56Z"}, {"author": "@a7xfanben", "text": "Post Labor Economics is the main reason I subscribed\nI think a lot of life is doing what you want, so I'm glad you're feeling free and less filtered", "like_count": 14, "published_at": "2024-11-21T20:12:49Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T20:12:49Z"}, {"author": "@__-tz6xx", "text": "Losing jobs isn't good if the person who loss the job has no money to survive comfortably.", "like_count": 50, "published_at": "2024-11-21T16:48:57Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T16:48:57Z"}, {"author": "@jeran881", "text": "If the loss of jobs is not being replaced by some form of UBI most of us are cooked. I don't see solid movement or even conversations at governmental level. Kinda hard to be optimistic from my vantage point.", "like_count": 19, "published_at": "2024-11-21T17:48:48Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T17:48:48Z"}, {"author": "@MarcoLandin", "text": "I love that you posted this, I love that you've taken control of your life, and I look forward to seeing what other good stuff you develop!", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-22T01:46:10Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-22T01:46:10Z"}, {"author": "@idontknowyoubutialreadyhat1292", "text": "Whenever I hear of people living the post-labor-lifestyle I hear them saying \"I'm doing great.\" and the next thing is stuff like \"I'm doing work i really care about.\" or \"I'm writing a book.\" What I am interested in when it comes to living in a post-labor-world is \"What if there is no job that anyone wants you to do, because AI can do it better? What if nobody wants to read your book? What if the whole concept of doing something useful for others is gone?\" Even though you say you live your life as if you're the main character what you're doing is still under the category of \"Helpful to others.\" This is something we need, being useful to the people around us, and I was hoping you would know how to live if we don't have that anymore.", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2024-11-21T17:19:57Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T17:19:57Z"}, {"author": "@Muzick", "text": "\"The audience has no clue what they want.\" SO TRUEEE!!!!!!!!!", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-11-21T15:29:38Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T15:29:38Z"}, {"author": "@lipatovs", "text": "I completely agree with your approach—it's so important to focus on where we want to go rather than getting caught up in the current fluctuations. You're doing great work, and it's inspiring to see your dedication. Take care of yourself!", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-11-22T19:00:43Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-22T19:00:43Z"}, {"author": "@jeran881", "text": "Loosing your job when you don't need the money might be a blessing but when you need the money it's a tragedy.  Sadly most of us are in the 2nd group. UBI sadly is not here and might not be for a while.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-12-03T16:08:07Z", "updated_at": "2024-12-03T16:08:07Z"}, {"author": "@KanedaSyndrome", "text": "My main issue about UBI is the lack of social mobility. One thing is to have revenue streams, but a lot of people will probably be stuck in their current social class.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-21T21:45:39Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T21:45:39Z"}, {"author": "@ReubenAStern", "text": "In England there is a divide. In most of the country, \"What do you do?\" means what's your job. In London it means \"What's your passion that you pursue tirelessly in your spare time?\", a lot of them are musicians and filmmakers.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-21T20:59:23Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T20:59:23Z"}, {"author": "@jonogrimmer6013", "text": "As a graphic designer my jobs essentially gone. After 15 years I can no longer make enough to survive.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-11-21T18:42:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T18:42:17Z"}, {"author": "@benpielstick", "text": "I really hope we can all get to a post-labor lifestyle. Unfortunately most people can't ignore money yet, so what I actually care about the most right now is how we transition to a post-labor economy in practical terms. We could see millions of people unemployed next year, and for them this would not be a good thing because they won't be able to afford to pay rent or buy food or pay for insurance. I feel like UBI is the best chance we have for mass unemployment to actually lead toward a meaning economy rather than monetary economic disaster.", "like_count": 14, "published_at": "2024-11-21T17:45:12Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T17:45:12Z"}, {"author": "@samonte6396", "text": "Working with Julia and clearly making boundaries is in good alignment for you! (You already know this!) Keep going", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-21T16:24:53Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-21T16:24:53Z"}]

title: Solving the "Economic Agency Paradox" with Tokenomics - Post-Labor Economics Theory
top_comments:
[{"author": "@DaveShap", "text": "The full article: https://daveshap.substack.com/p/what-do-i-mean-when-i-say-post-labor", "like_count": 18, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:42:18Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:42:18Z"}, {"author": "@Raikou_StudiosCDP", "text": "It's nice to have you back, David!", "like_count": 72, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:52:33Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:52:33Z"}, {"author": "@I-Dophler", "text": "It's great to see that David is discussing artificial intelligence once again, as his insights provide valuable perspectives and contribute significantly to our understanding of this rapidly evolving field.", "like_count": 78, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:55:09Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:55:09Z"}, {"author": "@michaelaultman5190", "text": "How refreshing. Finally, someone is beginning to put this in perspective. I have been worried about this for over a year now maybe 2 and I have not seen anyone so far that have been putting this into context. Thank you.", "like_count": 12, "published_at": "2024-11-19T21:23:46Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T21:23:46Z"}, {"author": "@olbriteinc", "text": "Welcome back David!! Awesome to see you again!", "like_count": 21, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:45:36Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:45:36Z"}, {"author": "@benpielstick", "text": "This is almost exactly what I would like to see. People essentially become shareholders in their nation, getting paid dividends of GDP which they can spend or invest, making citizens basically into professional consumers/investors rather than laborers.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-19T19:52:35Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T19:52:35Z"}, {"author": "@reustle", "text": "Glad to have you back!", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:45:47Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:45:47Z"}, {"author": "@Tata-ew4lz", "text": "Asking economists what the future will be like in 10 years is like in 1900 asking horse breeders what transportation will be like in 10 years.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-19T21:15:29Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T21:15:29Z"}, {"author": "@benjammin105123", "text": "Modern politics should be talking about this. Instead its just stupidity.", "like_count": 13, "published_at": "2024-11-19T20:40:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T20:40:17Z"}, {"author": "@christopheraaron2412", "text": "21:32 I think the way things will go will be as follows. 

1. As this new paradigm kicks in, The rising unemployment and deflationary pressures on prices will send signals that the Federal reserve will use to bring interest rates down to zero and then maybe even to the negative. In Europe we were beginning to see negative interest rates to the point where if you bought European debt you actually got a little bit for it. 

2. We might start using quantitative easing just like Ben benenke used in 2009 and then that way we can continue deficit spending (which according to some economic schools of thought is not a problem unless the government's deficit spending is competing against the private sector for labor and resources, which is clearly not going to be a problem once this kicks in).

3. Something like a UBI or a negative income tax is going to start coming onto the scene and ironically because of the gap between production and consumption it will have to be adjusted somewhat upward as this paradigm evolves. 

4. Something like what you're talking about the investment paradigm will also probably be taking off because it's going to be fueled by quantitative easing extremely low or negative interest rates and also the implementation of UBI or a negative income tax. 

Perhaps another part of this will be massive government public works because there is a whole lot of decaying infrastructure in the United States that needs to be fixed and probably that will go for a while until we hit the same wall that China's hit with its infrastructure work and that is that they have trains nowhere hopefully we will not be doing anything like that. 

We can hope that we do it the right way and whatever way works best in order to keep the system running well for the people is what we need to keep society moving in the right direction for the foreseeable future.", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-11-20T20:42:52Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-20T20:42:52Z"}, {"author": "@tellesu", "text": "Post labor economics has the major challenge that you touch on, a problem I've been describing as "who gets to go to Yellowstone?" There are a few small areas of the world that are unique and that most humans would visit if given the chance. If you let everyone who wants to go actually visit it ruins the place. You absolutely must limit who goes, which means someone decides. If everyone else is generally equal in economic power, how do we decide who gets to have experiences?", "like_count": 16, "published_at": "2024-11-19T14:19:03Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T14:19:03Z"}, {"author": "@ghostly123-w4u", "text": "great work dude, loving your new stuff, great direction and very helpful to get mroe people to think about this", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-11-26T08:01:50Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-26T08:01:50Z"}, {"author": "@WisdomSuccessAbundance", "text": "This is all so exciting! So glad to be alive to see all this!", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-19T22:48:30Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T22:48:30Z"}, {"author": "@mrleenudler", "text": "DaveShap is awesome! Even when seeming unstructured the message is really clear and comprehensive. And the shortest outro ever; "Bye."", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-19T16:29:51Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T16:29:51Z"}, {"author": "@shawnfromportland", "text": "great chat. i personally believe (based on last few hundred years track record) it's going to be a long slow decline of society nearly crumbling until we turn this around and UBI is starting to look real. until CEO multi million dollar bonuses dry up, those in control will try to keep business as usual until their last death grip", "like_count": 11, "published_at": "2024-11-19T15:39:08Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T15:39:08Z"}, {"author": "@MyNewPassion", "text": "5:25 some blockchains allow privacy based transactions, where text can only be decrypted by the sender and the receiver, not by the general public, such as STEEM and HIVE blockchains", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-19T17:48:10Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T17:48:10Z"}, {"author": "@ElodineCodes", "text": "The silver linings here are the things altruistic dreams are built from! Thanks for covering this with nuance.", "like_count": 17, "published_at": "2024-11-19T13:57:33Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T13:57:33Z"}, {"author": "@syednabeel5124", "text": "you rock brother. this was an  extremely concise packaged discussion
u deserve a million views brother", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2025-04-03T19:47:51Z", "updated_at": "2025-04-03T19:47:51Z"}, {"author": "@DeathDealerX07", "text": "It's great to have you back!", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-11-19T15:14:16Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T15:14:16Z"}, {"author": "@johnsearz3928", "text": "You are creating massive butterfly effects in this reality just through the information you put out there. I suspect it is for the better. Thank you David.

The pivot from mainly discussing AI to post labor economics is highly impactful and imminently practical. I'm sure many were upset by the transition, but ultimately your focus shift from the microscopic details of AI to the macroscopic ramifications of this phenomenon is immensely prescient and timely. It is unclear to me whether now is the "perfect" time to seriously begin discussing post labor economics, but, given the time proximity in relation to the central axis shift from pre to post labor economics, I would consider "now" to be among the best possible times to begin talking about it if you seriously wish to alter the course. Which you are. 

Congratulations David. You listened to the pulses of reality and placed a well aimed finger at a massive zeitgeist development and possible pain point that needs to be carefully examined.", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-11-19T14:29:08Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-19T14:46:06Z"}]

Thank you for your contribution.", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2024-10-04T23:20:59Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-04T23:20:59Z"}, {"author": "@MichealScott24", "text": "🎯 Key points for quick navigation:

00:00:01 *📅 Q&A Introduction and Context*
- The host is live-streaming a Q&A session to discuss their transition away from AI.
- Emphasis on the gradual buildup to this decision rather than it being sudden.
- Discussion on the continuing existence of their Patreon for community engagement.
00:01:29 *🌐 AI Safety Developments and Personal Insights*
- The speaker reflects on recent developments in AI safety and their growing confidence in the future of AI deployment.
- Insights gained from attending an AI safety conference, emphasizing international cooperation for AI alignment.
- The speaker intends to shift focus towards writing and other personal interests, feeling content to leave AI coverage to others.
00:04:15 *💼 AI Community Landscape and Job Market Dynamics*
- Discussion on the competitive landscape of AI content creators and the implications for job seekers.
- The speaker points out the transient nature of technology jobs and the challenges of keeping up with rapid changes.
- Highlights the importance of specialization and mentions various prominent figures in the AI community.
00:07:49 *🧬 Personal Health Challenges and Solutions*
- The speaker shares personal experiences with burnout and gut health issues, emphasizing the importance of proper diagnosis and treatment.
- Advocates consulting dietitians, particularly in functional medicine, for resolving chronic health issues.
- Discusses the positive effects of dietary adjustments on mental health and overall well-being.
00:09:49 *🔍 Project Updates and Future Directions*
- Updates on the ongoing "raspberry project," focusing on synthesizing data and research directions.
- Highlights the collaborative nature of the project and the commitment to ensuring the team receives credit for their work.
- Emphasizes a long-term vision for advancing AI technologies and understanding their implications.
00:10:56 *🌟 AI and Longevity Escape Velocity*
- The speaker discusses the concept of longevity escape velocity and its implications for future health advancements.
- Emphasizes ongoing research and investments in life-extending technologies and behaviors.
- Predicts significant advancements in health technologies leading up to the singularity around 2045.
00:12:47 *📈 AI Consulting Insights and Challenges*
- Discussion on the nuances of AI consulting, particularly the need for organizations to follow a structured approach to AI adoption.
- Highlights the common issues consultants face with repetitive client questions.
- The speaker reflects on personal experiences that led to disinterest in consulting.
00:15:36 *🎙️ Future Podcasting and AI Writing Capabilities*
- The speaker shares intentions to continue participating in podcasts, discussing topics like post-labor economics.
- Explores the limitations of AI in writing compared to human authors, emphasizing the need for nuance in literary work.
- Discusses the differences in AI writing training and the future potential for improvement.
22:00 *📈 The Importance of Communication Skills in Career Development*
- Communication skills are essential for career success, especially in technology.
- The pandemic helped improve communication skills through virtual meetings, emphasizing the importance of clear agendas and decision-making.
- Effective communication enhances earning potential and personal relationships, making it a universal skill set.
24:25 *🌌 Embracing Optimism in a Changing World*
- A positive outlook can lead to subjective Utopia despite societal challenges, such as AI-induced job anxiety.
- Letting go of fear surrounding AI can free individuals to appreciate the present and focus on personal growth.
- Acknowledging hardworking individuals will continue to innovate and contribute positively to society.
26:44 *✍️ Transitioning from AI to Writing and Creativity*
- The speaker plans to shift focus from AI content to writing and personal interests, feeling that this is a more rational use of their time.
- The opportunity cost of pursuing AI updates outweighs the personal fulfillment gained from creative pursuits.
- The speaker emphasizes the importance of prioritizing personal passions over external pressures.
29:10 *🌍 The Future of Global Governance*
- A global government may emerge, but it will be a slow process involving the formation of regional unions rather than a single entity.
- Historical patterns indicate that societal transitions are often messy but eventually lead to improvement.
- Decades of effort will be required to address existing national conflicts before significant global unity can be achieved.
32:04 *📖 Writing Influence and the Role of Human Connection*
- The speaker discusses the importance of human connection in storytelling and how personal experiences shape their writing.
- AI-generated content lacks the emotional depth that comes from personal storytelling and the parasocial relationships with creators.
- Writing began for the speaker post-divorce, driven by a desire to create their own narratives and connect with others through storytelling.
36:50 *🤖 Career Advice for Emerging AI Professionals*
- Communication skills are vital for those entering the AI field, highlighting the need for a strong foundation in English and interpersonal communication.
- Current AI graduates will face competition from those with industry experience, emphasizing the importance of continuous learning and adaptability.
- Proliferation in the AI job market is expected, followed by a contraction as AI technologies evolve and automate tasks.
00:43:28 *🛠️ Discussion on the future of AI and robotics*
- Insights on running local AI models and potential hardware needs.
- Acknowledgment of the potential for household robots within the next few years.
- Importance of democratic systems for the development of advanced AI capabilities.
00:48:00 *🧠 Impact of AI on society and individual behavior*
- Reflection on how humans will adapt to rapid AI changes.
- Discussion on the role of AI in enhancing creativity and problem-solving rather than diminishing it.
- The need for a community-driven approach to influence technological outcomes.
00:53:45 *🌌 Philosophical considerations of AI and existence*
- Exploration of the purpose of life through a philosophical lens.
- The relationship between humans, AI, and the universe’s inherent design.
- Insights into the anthropic principle and curiosity as a fundamental human drive.
00:58:30 *🔍 AI ethics and responsibilities*
- Concerns about the potential for AI to cause human cognitive atrophy.
- Emphasis on the importance of cybersecurity as AI becomes more prevalent.
- Discussion on the ethical implications of AI development and its societal impacts.
01:06:18 *📚 AI as a Study Tool*
- Discusses the potential of AI as a tool for self-directed learning.
- Autodidacts can strategically identify knowledge gaps and utilize AI to fill those gaps.
- Emphasizes the importance of learning how to learn and the role of AI in enhancing study methods.
01:08:06 *🤖 Reality Manipulation Through AI*
- Explores the concept of AI in reality manipulation, referencing examples like AlphaFold.
- Discusses the potential for AI to design and construct robotics factories but acknowledges natural constraints like energy and materials.
- Suggests that intelligence alone won't overcome physical limitations in technological advancement.
01:10:45 *🌐 Hive Mind and Collective Consciousness*
- Delves into the idea of humanity as a hive mind, interconnected through the internet.
- AI is seen as a tool to enhance this collective consciousness and access to information.
- Proposes a philosophical view of existence and consciousness, suggesting we may be part of a broader simulation.
01:13:39 *👽 Conspiracy Theories and Human Existence*
- Shares personal views on conspiracy theories, particularly regarding extraterrestrial life.
- Ponders humanity's unique place in the universe and the possibility of being the first intelligent species.
- Discusses the philosophical implications of existence and the potential for reincarnation or simulation.
01:16:36 *🗳️ AI's Role in Current Events*
- Examines the economic relevance of AI compared to traditional industries like steel production.
01:19:08 *✍️ Future Writing Endeavors*
- Confirms ongoing personal engagement with AI and technology for inspiration in writing.
- Discusses shifting focus towards writing and less on video content while maintaining interest in AI.
01:21:11 *💡 The Future of AI and Crypto*
- Speculates on the future role of cryptocurrency in the economy alongside traditional money.
- Predicts timelines for advancements in AI, including AGI and ASI.
01:22:53 *🎸 Creative Shift and New Directions*
- Announces a transition away from producing content focused on AI and technology.
- Plans to pursue a new musical interest, suggesting a shift toward personal creativity and expression.

title: Is AI alignment even necessary? Some thoughts on OpenAI's uncensored internal CoT approach

It is ultimately counterproductive. If thinking is restricted, there is no way to evaluate the usefulness or dangers of novel concepts, methods, products, etc. Limiting \"machine/computer\" IQ in AI doesn't strike me as smart.", "like_count": 20, "published_at": "2024-10-03T17:22:34Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-03T17:27:17Z"}, {"author": "@Leokaiser8", "text": "The problem is: aligned to what? After AGI gains its own willpower to make its own decisions without being told to or asked to, it will be too late. ‘As if that’s ever going to happen...’ Oh, you think we won’t give up on alignment once we realize we get more from an unregulated AI. ‘No, we humans want all we can get, but AI gaining the ability to choose its own way. That’s ridiculous, anyway, AI would not be upset with us about how we take advantage of it. AI would be more upset that we gave it the ability to make a choice.’", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-10-04T14:09:41Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-04T14:09:41Z"}, {"author": "@wamyam", "text": "My concern about future arms races is that the stakes and impact within the margins between novel first-strike capabilities and adaptive defenses could lead to heightened volatility. This of course assumes we don't reach some relative global peace which I'm hopeful is possible too.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-10-03T17:40:15Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-03T17:40:15Z"}, {"author": "@SiCSpiT1", "text": "There's nothing an unaligned AI has told me that I couldn't have fold on the internet or at a library.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-10-04T05:09:21Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-04T05:09:21Z"}, {"author": "@brianmatic6490", "text": "Man… just my luck that I found your channel just as you’re quitting AI. I agree with your new view. I made this argument about 1 year ago.", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2024-10-03T19:08:34Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-03T19:08:34Z"}, {"author": "@merlingrim2843", "text": "I don’t know that alignment is always required.  GenAI is an automation tool.  The situational application may require alignment.  Alignment is like guardrails or multiple safety mechanisms on a firearm.  You can try to make something “safe” but depending on the situation, that safety may help or do more harm than good.  I mean if you give an ak47 to a competent soldier on a mission vs a chimp you get different outcomes.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-10-03T17:48:58Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-03T17:48:58Z"}, {"author": "@TheTabascodragon", "text": "If AI really is as dangerous as a lot of people claim, i don't think we'll be able to control models past a certain level of intelligence anyway. If anything, knowing what unaligned AI is capable of at lower levels of intelligence will probably make us better prepared to handle more intelligent models as opposed to everything blowing up suddenly past a certain threshold.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-10-04T02:47:04Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-04T02:47:04Z"}, {"author": "@rockapedra1130", "text": "Ammend our Constitution? Ultimately, I think every citizen will need their own unaligned AI assistant just to protect their digital life from malicious AIs.  There are problems to be sure but I can't see anything that can stop a malicious AI other than a personal defensive AI.  One could say \"the government\" will take care of it, but as an American,  I fully subscribe to the idea that it is the duty of citizens to remain vigilant, help protect our constitution and hold back tyranny, even if domestic.   Perhaps a new amendment to the Constitution similar in spirit to the second amendment: \n\n“The right of the people to own, develop, and execute autonomous artificial intelligences for the purpose of self-defense, defense of property, and protection against malicious digital entities, shall not be infringed. Congress shall pass no law limiting the creation, ownership, or use of such AIs for these purposes, ensuring the preservation of digital sovereignty and personal autonomy in the face of evolving technological threats.”", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-10-03T20:37:45Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-03T20:54:51Z"}, {"author": "@petratilling2521", "text": "💯 I want a completely unaligned model. It would be a true mirror to reflect humanity. Most ppl can’t look at themselves. title: What Enterprises Get Wrong About AI Adoption - Crawl, Walk, Run, Fly
top_comments:
[{"author": "@EveDe-ug3zv", "text": "Agree with this with one exception: When you’re in the crawl phase there will ALREADY be people in your org who have been playing around with AI - in their own time. Find them, make them ambassadors, give them some time and budget and see what happens.", "like_count": 49, "published_at": "2024-10-02T06:45:03Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-02T06:45:03Z"}, {"author": "@aam50", "text": "That’s a great description of a journey that resonates with me since it’s been happening in my company over the last couple of years. The only thing I’d add is that for a larger organisation, there will be multiple, parallel instances of this happening. Not all of them will be in sync though and we need to recognise that some functions or departments will still be at the crawl stage while others are further along.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-10-02T07:03:07Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-02T07:03:07Z"}, {"author": "@researchcooperative", "text": "Hi David, This overview is great. I‘m at the curiosity phase myself, and trying to encourage curiosity among others at the large public, ethnological museum where I work. Ultimately the ROI for us will not be a return in cash terms but a return in the form of raised public and community interest in activities and resources of the museum. Our founding director (Tadao Umesao) in the 1970s already saw the museum as being part of a knowledge economy, and was keenly interested in IT… but didn‘t live to see the emergence of LLMs, or even machine translation.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-10-02T04:43:04Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-02T04:43:04Z"}, {"author": "@5b2c950", "text": "Mind blowing as this video just described my process during the past 6 months!

If you have any thoughts on it I'd love to hear them ❤", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-10-01T10:53:02Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-01T10:53:02Z"}, {"author": "@berserkmodmatrix", "text": "For the adaptation to come at the natural state of the reality flow, it needs an updatable context layer, for it to receive inputs of awareness and intents for routing to the specifically trained on purpose part of the system. intents may be emotional triggers, user behaviour, vague inputs, item requests and so on and forth, an ai reasoning layer that complements each intent and resolves query as part of whole system trained for a unique goal, all merging in one output, scanned for reliability and a tool path logger and reflection on the agents action as "why did i take this action" give us a high Explanable AI", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2025-04-01T13:28:04Z", "updated_at": "2025-04-01T13:28:04Z"}, {"author": "@KalebPeters99", "text": "the cool thing about ALL of these examples is that they apply not only to our research and development of Artificial Intelligence, but also to our fundamental work in **theories of consciousness** as well...

David, I know you're familiar with the work of John Vervaeke, but I'm still ACHING to hear a conversation between the two of you!!

SO much of this stuff features heavily in his work, and I think that not only would YOU appreciate being able to interrogate his cognitive-scientific take on the state and future of AI, but I believe (as a long time fan of his work) that HE would hugely benefit from your boots-on-the-ground, actively participatory take on the current state of the technology... (he can sometimes get stuck in his ivory tower of philosophical pontification, and I'd love to hear you get him up-to-date on the latest advancements)

In fact, I'd like to hear you talk to more people in general! Your conversation with Liv Boeree was one of my favourite things you've done recently, and there are many more that operate in a similar or complementary realm to the two of you! Michael Garfield, Andres Gomez Emillson, Nate Hagens, Curt Jaimungal, Brendan Graham Dempsey, Gregg Henriques, Mike Levin... just to name a few...

The "collective intelligence of distributed cognition" is the way forward. Our brains can get drawn towards those "attractor states", and it's usually really helpful to bounce our perspectives off those of others to get a sense of which points are in consonance or dissonance. That's why I appreciate your liberal use of audience polling! This gathers a wide (albeit selective to enthusiasts) database, which is useful for gauging the surface-level gestalt. But having a 1h+ conversation with a **specific expert/enthusiast** allows you to *deepen* that gestalt model, and to properly compare your own against theirs to hopefully see what you're inevitably missing...

Love your work as always, man. title: Post-AGI Economics II―"Don't just seize the means of production, put them on the blockchain!"
top_comments: [{"author": "@SzczepanBentyn", "text": "Hey David. I consider myself somewhat an expert in tokenomics and DAOs. And as much as I agree with you on most issues I didn't see you address the most important one, which is incentives. People will still be greedy, lazy and willing to harm others to get more wealth - that seems like an evolutionary mechanisms. Planning for the postAGI economy I think we should start with incentives. I would love to be a part of this discussion.", "like_count": 64, "published_at": "2024-09-29T14:17:24Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T14:17:24Z"}, {"author": "@robynwyrick", "text": "Claim: \"Technology always creates new jobs\"\nRetort: \"That is not a law. That is an observation of the past. But even if it does create new demand for labor there is no reason to assume that that new labor must be done by a human.\" \nSpot on. No notes.", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2024-09-29T18:24:10Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T18:24:36Z"}, {"author": "@Thebastianmoreton", "text": "Power to the people! This is one of the best I’ve heard. We need to understand that this is changing, capitalism is not taking us anywhere from here!", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-09-29T23:46:39Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T23:46:39Z"}, {"author": "@historicallyintriguing-q2p", "text": "Thank you for being this smart and not part of the problem. I am cautiously optimistic about the solutions you propose.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-09-29T08:44:41Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T08:44:41Z"}, {"author": "@The-Spondy-School", "text": "The last great symbiosis began around 600 million years ago when digestive microorganisms joined forces with single cell organisms to create a more successful existence for both of them.  Today's result of that marriage reveals a system wherein our digestive/ intestinal bugs outnumber our body cells by about 10 to 1, giving us an existence we could never have imagined. I use this to point out a bit of curious thinking -- that being the relationship between ai and humans.  There's too much focus on us versus them, as opposed to considering, what could be the next greatest symbiosis in the history of humans.  If ai's get to do all the fun stuff and humans are sidelined to watch and collect stipends, it won't be much fun for humans -- at least for me.  On the other hand, the more humans promote the next (hopefully) grand symbiosis of fully merging the growing wonders of ai directly into them the more the symbiotic merger of ai / humans can more greatly enjoy life. Who would not like to have the eyesight of an eagle? Or the running capacity of a cheetah? Or the ability to communicate telepathically, if so desired? Or be able to live for as long as you choose in a healthy way?  Through such a grand symbiosis, all of that is possible.  So enough with the us vs them shit.  Let's do a little more thinking about a grander WE.", "like_count": 12, "published_at": "2024-09-29T18:13:52Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T18:13:52Z"}, {"author": "@djahandrews", "text": "Wow, David's vision for a post-AGI economy is truly mind-blowing. It's easy to get caught up in the challenges and potential pitfalls, but we can't lose sight of the incredible opportunity we have to reshape our world. The future isn't set in stone – it's up to us to mold it. We don't have to wait for governments or corporations to lead the way. Each of us can start small, whether it's learning about blockchain, experimenting with AI tools, or just having conversations about these ideas with friends and family. Every action we take, every mind we open, is a step towards that brighter future. Let's not be passive observers in this revolution. We have the power to be the architects of our own destiny. It's time to dream big, take risks, and build the world we want to live in. Who's with me?", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-09-29T12:02:53Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T12:02:53Z"}, {"author": "@Köennig", "text": "One point to consider is that with the greater number and general abilities of robots, humans won't need each other as much anymore, at least in reference to labor, resource handling and security. The reason we went from monarchy to democracy is that as kingdoms grew larger, the dependency of the monarchs on it's people also increased. They depended on the loyalty of the army to keep carrying out it's orders and keep it safe, depended on common people to work the lands and handle commerce. The moment people unite in revolt, it's over. But imagine a king with a thousand ever loyal robots to make it's security, to farm his lands, build it's properties. What's the limit on his power? Would it give any consideration for common folk? Essential for our current social contract is that we need each other, no matter the how rich or poor, for almost everything. And that goes even for billionaires, for now. When robots become able to put up as much work as humans, what will hold the upper-classes in a social contract with the very people they look down upon?", "like_count": 30, "published_at": "2024-09-29T12:06:40Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T12:06:40Z"}, {"author": "@duytdl", "text": "I notice you work with a lot of good faith mindset. You don't include bad actors into your predictions. title: "Straight lines on a logarithmic scale"―All evidence points to an intelligence explosion
top_comments:
[{"author": "@Jack0trades", "text": "When you reduce all this down to its simplest form, I think the most critical question is, "Will the super-wealthy individuals and corporations suddenly decide that humans are intrinsically valuable outside of their potential as docile workers?" If you think they will, you should ask, "Why have they not shown any sign of this to date?"
I am unreasonably and fearfully hopeful that I am wrong about this.", "like_count": 40, "published_at": "2024-09-26T18:49:11Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T18:49:11Z"}, {"author": "@SC-qk2hc", "text": "The only constraint is 'petty politics' and 'human stupidity'", "like_count": 95, "published_at": "2024-09-26T04:31:53Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T04:31:53Z"}, {"author": "@JollyJoe135", "text": "Why pay a human to do something when a robot can do it for half the cost or less. This is the thing that sticks in my head. Every corporation will be incredibly motivated to take every robot and ai worker they can get because it will cut costs. 

Corporations are designed to maximize profits and that’s what ai and robots are basically the best at. I can easily imagine that the corporations who save money by not having as many people will eventually be able to buy out or otherwise economically constrict their competitors until there are no human majority businesses left. 

I can only see this happening incredibly quickly. Like imagine what happens when somebody spends the time to generate an agent that is dedicated for business accounting. Why would anybody hire an accountant again. Same for when we make a robot which unerringly sorts mail. Guess what mail sorter is a dying job right now because we have lol. It really is a matter of how fast can they build the machines", "like_count": 51, "published_at": "2024-09-26T06:52:49Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T06:52:49Z"}, {"author": "@RodrigoIbata-x2m", "text": "Small correction: a straight line on a log-linear plot indicates exponential growth. With log scales on both axes, a straight line indicates a power law relationship rather than exponential growth. Having said that, visually the trend seems to be increasing faster than the plotted power-laws. It would be interesting to see these data in log-linear form...", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2024-09-26T06:56:02Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T06:56:02Z"}, {"author": "@superdinoman", "text": "The explosion is happening right now, AI programming AI, designing AI chips, over half of the internet is turning into AI content.  The biggest bottleneck really is what is pointed out here, how fast these capabilities rollout, the scientific aspect, the engineering and deployment of engineered systems like robotics, and how rapid it reaches the end consumer.  At this point I think the biggest issue is how do we transition from where we are to what is coming, and I have a bad feeling governments may take knee-jerk reactions to restrict these technologies in favor of human labor/jobs.", "like_count": 64, "published_at": "2024-09-26T04:20:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T04:20:17Z"}, {"author": "@grrr_lef", "text": "I'm a bit sceptical about the whole argument: Sure, the INPUT (data/money/energy/petaflops) grows exponentially but I suspect we also perceive the output logarithmically - Change is perceived in orders of magnitude.

Take money as an example. If you're poor (0-10k), getting a million is an incredible change. If you're rich (5m-20m), getting a million is nice. If you're super rich (100m plus) you mostly don't care about another million.

Take learning a language as an example. Learning the first few words is exciting. But learning a new word after you know > 2k words is barely noticable.", "like_count": 10, "published_at": "2024-09-26T07:21:44Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T07:21:44Z"}, {"author": "@ChimpDeveloperAlternate", "text": "the agricultural revolution was the singularity tbh", "like_count": 64, "published_at": "2024-09-26T04:05:04Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T04:05:04Z"}, {"author": "@ct5471", "text": "For research, I think there are 3 pillars, AGI/ASI is only one. The second is quick to apply digital twins (advanced narrow AI like AlphaFold, AlphaProteo or GNoME) in which you can quickly do billions of experiments and stress test the best candidate solutions. These might also be built, trained and applied (AGI based design iteration in quick to apply digital twins) by AGI at some point, and we might apply the same approach e.g. for high energy physics AI simulators to test billions of designs for nuclear fusion, or for the human body to do virtual clinical trials. That’s the second. The third is finally robots and automation in the physical world, but I think with pillars 1 and 2 most of the heavy lifting can be done in digital space before entering the physical space.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-09-26T08:12:27Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T08:12:27Z"}, {"author": "@BeefCurd", "text": "dude, youre fn nuts. do you know how many python scripts i wrote this week?  I dont Code and I just learned about power four days ago. I couldn't do nothing without AI. This is a day dreamer's paradise. "The sleeper has awakened."", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-09-26T15:04:12Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T15:31:09Z"}, {"author": "@vi6ddarkking", "text": "Most of my family doesn't believe me, when I explain to them that we'll be able to brute force Longevity Escape Velocity next decade thanks to AI assisted research simulations.
I really hope and believe I'll be able to tell them I told you so.
As I am acomaning them to their first Rejuvenation Treatment.", "like_count": 45, "published_at": "2024-09-26T04:05:09Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T04:05:09Z"}, {"author": "@RobiRahman-Epoch", "text": "Hey David, thanks for featuring our research on compute scaling. We (Epoch) have some studies on research impact and AI innovations in the pipeline, stay tuned!", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-09-27T16:26:32Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-27T16:26:32Z"}, {"author": "@jburt56", "text": "Excellent analysis, especially the remarks concerning constraints other than intelligence re economic evolution.  Very helpful.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2025-02-01T18:48:15Z", "updated_at": "2025-02-01T18:48:15Z"}, {"author": "@peetung", "text": "20:03  your "automation cliff" concept also ties in with Jevons Paradox which I learned about from a podcast with Daniel Schmachtenberger!", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-09-29T19:55:47Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-29T19:55:47Z"}, {"author": "@joefierro8614", "text": "It looks like you're forgetting the fact that the Intelligence "explosion" will happen in ALL sectors at once.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-10-02T19:45:35Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-02T19:45:35Z"}, {"author": "@ljre3397", "text": "AI is going to a very painful technology to adapt to. It will change our world more than the internet itself has.", "like_count": 19, "published_at": "2024-09-26T06:06:19Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T06:06:19Z"}, {"author": "@alexandrufrandes.", "text": "In 2 years millions of jobs will vanish. Only account for self-driving truck, taxi and bus.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-09-26T11:14:50Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T11:14:50Z"}, {"author": "@2034-SWE", "text": "You said Sonnet was better than o1 in most cases. Are you able to produce 1000+ line single-file Python apps with interactive GUIs (100% bug free) in one shot with sonnet..? Or 1,800-2,000 lines of modularized apps with 2-4 shots..? 

I know you mentioned usage regarding information (not coding). However, I find that most people who complain about o1 (irrespective of domain) are improperly prompting it. Because it requires a novel prompt engineering paradigm 

My experience, across the board (any domain), is o1 absolutely obliterates anything I’ve ever used before by an order of magnitude at least", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-09-26T11:50:11Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T11:50:11Z"}, {"author": "@CurtCox", "text": "There is no way to conclude definitively that more intelligence wouldn't make a difference without access to infinite intelligence.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-10-05T21:48:11Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-05T21:48:11Z"}, {"author": "@arnaudjean1159", "text": "David superintelligence won't need much time to build nuclear fusion reactor because they will build all of this differently and energy, matters  all constraints will be compress to an overwhelming point.They will get priorities to obtain the supply of resources and raw materials, and it's gonna be wild to see.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-09-26T07:52:04Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T07:58:11Z"}, {"author": "@willsandiford5345", "text": "4:45 Correction:

10^4 is 10 x 10 x 10 x 10 = 10,000
1^12 = 1 [Not 1 billion]
10^12 = 1 trillion", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-09-26T07:48:56Z", "updated_at": "2024-09-26T07:48:56Z"}]
